name: Machu Picchu
description: An ancient Inca citadel located high in the Andes. It’s a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

name: Lake Titicaca
description: The highest navigable lake in the world, home to the Uros people, who live on floating islands made of reeds.

name: Cusco
description: Former capital of the Inca Empire. It retains a blend of Inca and colonial architecture, including Plaza de Armas and the Temple of the Sun

name: Nazca Lines
description: Mysterious geoglyphs carved into the desert floor, best viewed from the air. They are believed to have astronomical or religious significance.

name: Arequipa and Colca Canyon
description: A colonial city made from white volcanic stone. Nearby is the Colca Canyon, one of the deepest canyons in the world, home to the Andean condor.

name: Paracas and Ballestas Islands
address: Ica Region, Southern Coast of Peru
description: A marine reserve home to diverse wildlife such as sea lions, Humboldt penguins, and many bird species. The Ballestas Islands are often called The Galápagos of Peru.

name: Huacachina
address: Ica, 5 km from the city of Ica
description: A desert oasis surrounded by towering sand dunes. It's a popular spot for sandboarding and buggy rides, offering a unique desert experience.

name: Amazon - Pacaya Samiria National Reserve
description: The second-largest protected area in Peru, rich in biodiversity, home to pink dolphins, caimans, and an array of exotic birds and plants.
